allocated_capacity.description: The number of AWS Glue data processing units (DPUs

command.description: The command of the job. Defined below.

connections.description: The list of connections used for this job.

default_arguments.description: The map of default arguments for this job. You can specify arguments here that your own job-execution script consumes, as well as arguments that AWS Glue itself consumes. For information about how to specify and consume your own Job arguments, see the [Calling AWS Glue APIs in Python](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/aws-glue-programming-python-calling.html

execution_property.description: Execution property of the job. Defined below.

glue_version.description: The version of glue to use, for example "1.0". For information about available versions, see the [AWS Glue Release Notes](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/release-notes.html).

max_capacity.description: The maximum number of AWS Glue data processing units (DPUs

max_retries.description: The maximum number of times to retry this job if it fails.

name.description: The name you assign to this job. It must be unique in your account.

notification_property.description: Notification property of the job. Defined below.

role_arn.description: The ARN of the IAM role associated with this job.

timeout.description: The job timeout in minutes. The default is 2880 minutes (48 hours).

security_configuration.description: The name of the Security Configuration to be associated with the job.

worker_type.description: The type of predefined worker that is allocated when a job runs. Accepts a value of Standard, G.1X, or G.2X.

number_of_workers.description: The number of workers of a defined workerType that are allocated when a job runs.

arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of Glue Job
